item.title: Understanding the Somaliland Elections (2 of 3): The Contenders
item.description: Today Somaliland is holding its Presidential elections. To understand the significance of this event, one must understand the road that it has taken the Somalilanders to get to this point. This election has been delayed for over two years. This entry contains a small background on the three men on the ballot. Contender A: Faisal Ali “Warabe” Chairman UCID Party Faisal and his UCID party have long been seen as the also rans in Somaliland politics.

item.title: Understanding the Somaliland Elections (3 of 3): The Arguments
item.description: Today Somaliland is holding its Presidential elections. To understand the significance of this event, one must understand the road that it has taken the Somalilanders to get to this point. This election has been delayed for over two years. This entry contains a small background on the arguments that have been given by three men on the ballot. After discussing some of the background and the personas involved in the election, in this final installment I would like to discuss the arguments that have been raised by each of the three parties.

item.title: Understanding the Somaliland Elections (1 of 3): Background
item.description: [![Somaliland Victory Monument by Somaliland247 @flickr][2]][2] Somaliland Victory Monument by Somaliland247 @flickr Today Somaliland is holding its Presidential elections. To understand the significance of this event, one must understand the road that it has taken the Somalilanders to get to this point. This election has been delayed for over two years. This entry contains a small background on that time. The Presidential elections were originally scheduled for August, 2008. In April 2008, the Council of Elders – Somaliland’s upper house of Parliament (the Guurti) – extended the term of the President until April 6, 2009.
